resources.string: New face, old story. The wheel grinds on, grinds us down, doesn't it?
Mm-hmm. On the surface, we are still and quiet.
But there is a struggle in the darkness below.
The outcome...
Unpredictable.
Mm-hmm.
On the surface, we are still and quiet.
But there is a struggle in the darkness below.
The outcome...
Unpredictable.
Away with you, ghost. You'll scare away the fish. I remember you not and care not to, even if I could.
Old Stone Remembers
Desperate for a way to banish the cruel voice in your head, follow the rambling musings of the old hermit Yonas by seeking the wisdom of old stone carvings.
I offer you nothing, but you remain. I can give you a name, if that would help.
Some have called me Yonas. There are other names, but they will not speak themselves. One is enough, I think.
"What do you know of Corruption?"
Only those who seek misery would ask such a thing. You should banish your misery, like I have banished mine.
If you do not, only terrible things can come of it.
"I keep hearing a voice."
I do not see a hole in your head. Perhaps a hole in your mind.
The stones to the north are useful to fill such holes. You can read them, if you can find them. Replace your ghost with others.
Words immortalized in stone. It helps trap the ghosts… Ghosts of remembering.
Old stones have nothing but irrelevant answers to forgotten questions. You will not find truth here.
That was an invigorating climb. My body is so much younger than my head.
<g id="litearmor_think" />Hmm. This place is familiar. My feet remember what my mind does not. <g id="litearmor_headtilthmm" />Have you found any new voices, haunted one?
"What is a Soulwarden?"

<g id="litearmor_lookdownguilty" />What were they? My mind itches, yes, at the word. Perhaps this is where my ghost lives. <g id="litearmor_gesturebackthere" />That cave. Yes…inside it, something that needs retrieving.

<g id="litearmor_lookuparound" priority="high"/>The ghosts are loud here... this place remembers sorrow. My bones rattle with it. <g id="litearmor_tiltheadremember" />You went into the cave. What did you find?
"Why was armor in a bear cave?"

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />What does anything do in a bear cave? <g id="litearmor_takeitem5s" priority= "high" />Perhaps it was napping. Yet there is pain in the rent cloth. Shame, too. How odd.
<g id="litearmor_tiltheadremember" />The voice of that ghost has faded, but there are yet others in the stones to the north. <g id="litearmor_gestureleft" />Go, I won't be long behind.

<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />Something ended here. <g id="litearmor_lookdownguilty" priority= "high"/>Grief soaks this garment. My own, somehow. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />It is mine and not mine.
<g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />The flesh forgets, but the cloth remembers.
<g id="litearmor_tiltheadremember" />I hear my own voice, faint but in chorus with the ghosts here.
<g id="litearmor_worry" />My hands on the stone. My memories given to the land and taken from my soul… <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />a mercy, perhaps?
"What became of the Soulwardens?"
<g id="litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />It was… Corruption. It took their souls, those voices lost to time.
<g id="litearmor_youknow" />It will take all of us, before the sun sets on the world. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />You sooner, if your voice cannot be silenced.
Search the ruins of Chason Steep\nfor clues to Yonas's past
Slash through vines until you find\nthe stones Yonas mentioned
Read the Soulwarden Memorial
Destroy vines to find the Memorial
Read the Soulwarden Memorial
Look for Old Man Yonas
Speak to Old Man Yonas
Investigate the cave for clues to Yonas's past
Retrieve the Abandoned Armor Scraps
Ask Yonas about the Armor Scraps
Continue search for Soulwarden Memorials in the ruins of Alioth
Destroy vines to find the Memorial
Read the Soulwarden Memorial
Ascend to the Upper Section\nof the Ruins of Alioth
Destroy vines to find the final Memorial
Read the final Soulwarden Memorial
<g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Carts and wanderers, adventurers and fortune-seekers. <g id="litearmor_agree1" />They pass these ruins thinking only of safety, riches, and dust.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />How could they know what this place was? Sacred for some, <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />hopelessly tragic for others.
Strength of a Soul
To Learn more about the Soulwardens, face the Wardens' trials in the Tomb of the Old Warrior.
<g id="litearmor_agree1" />But there are answers here, a path that leads where many have sought to go, those who would stand against the Corruption.
<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />You speak of that voice that assaults your mind... this path may be the only way to see it silenced.
"A defense against Corruption?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />A valiant effort to stem the tide, perhaps, or <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />more likely to simply take a stand against the inevitable.

<g id="litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" priority="high" />There are no final answers here, nor anywhere, but it <g id="litearmor_agree1" />may yet be a reprieve for one who has been marked such as you.
"Wait, I've been marked?"
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />The voice you hear is not heard by all, and <g id="litearmor_youknow" />the power it pursues has become your burden to bear.
<g id="litearmor_agree1" />Go on then, seek the strength of the Soulwardens, face the trial in the Tomb of Old Warriors. <g id="litearmor_handheart" />It may be your only hope.
Come, human. Show me your resolve!
Can you endure? Can your soul carry the weight?
It is done. Claim your victory.
You prove your strength time and again, and I am impressed. We will make history together.
<g id="litearmor_handshipsconsider" />You will know when you have found your resolve. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Until then, I have nothing more to offer you.
<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" /> Well, imagine the kinds of people you run into on the roads around here.
<g id="male_pointBlame" />But you're looking a little haggard, if you don't mind me saying so. <g id="male_converseleft" />Had an eventful journey, have you?
Seek the Tomb of Old Warriors to begin the Soulwarden trials
Defeat Temple Guardians
Enter the Tomb of the Old Warrior
Read the First Promise
Ascend higher into the temple
Read the Second Promise
Complete the Trial to Unlock the Sealed Door
Defeat the Old Warrior's Remnant
Read the Third Promise
Look for Yonas back on the Road
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Ah, a visitor! I can tell by your starry-eyed demeanor that this is the first time you have ever set eyes on a city such as ours!
<g id="female_explains" />For a small fee, I can arrange for a guide to give you the grand tour. Simply say the word!
<g id="male_spreadarmscalm" />Skies are clear, a balmy southern wind, and a healthy energy about town. I'd say the markets will be hopping today!
Everyone in this town has lost their minds. What could be more important than an army pressing down from the north?
Do not get me started on the squabbles of the Factions. Short sighted fools, all of them!
<g id="female_nodding" />This is my kind of town. Color, opulence, fashion… thievery, gossip, drama…
<g id="female_youknow" />Just the sort of place that rewards the ambition of <g id="male_willcoverit" />a woman trying to seek her fortune.
<g id="guard_nod" />Welcome to Everfall, the prosperous beating heart of Aeternum.
<g id="guard_shrugbrief" />I know how it sounds, please don't scoff. <g id="guard_headshakeno" />The words are not mine, I'm just paid to say them.
<g id="male_casualHail" />Fancy meeting you here! Come to enjoy the view? <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Something tells me there are riches to be had here.
Talk of the Town
Yonas appears to have left you at the ruins, but luckily Grace O'Malley saw him pass by toward the town of Oxboro. Ask around to see if anyone has seen where he went off to.
<g id="female_thinking" />Thought I heard scuffling in those ruins. <g id="male_secretiveshort" />I was thinking there might be some treasure in there.
<g id="female_leanpointconvince" />But you don't look like you found something, you look like <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />you're still searching.
"Yes. Did you see an old man?"

<g id="female_thinking" />Now that you mention it, there was an old codger a few paces back. <g id="male_gestureBackThere" priority="high" />They’ve got a proper city that direction. I'll be going back soon enough.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />But if you want to go after this geezer, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />go that way, and just ask around town.
A lot can be gleaned from the locals. Especially when it comes to strangers.
<g id="guard_nod" />Welcome to Oxboro, traveler! I hope you've brought coin to spend and goods to trade. <g id="guard_gestureleftM" />We are always open for business!
"I'm looking for someone."

<g id="guard_shrugbrief" />Whatever services you seek, <g id="guard_nod" />you will find in Oxboro. I guarantee you that! All types for hire. <g id="guard_gestureleftM" />What manner of person do you seek?
"An old fisherman named Yonas."

<g id="guard_headtilthmm" />I have to say, that is a very specific person, and frankly one that no one has ever asked for. <g id="guard_shrugbrief" />You're the first. But I <g id="guard_nod" />did see him not long ago...
<g id="guard_headshakeno" />He's quite balmy, you know? And I'm not sure if he's for hire. <g id="guard_shrugbrief" />Constable Maecia often humors him with conversation. Ask her about him.
<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" />Ah, always good to welcome a guest to Oxboro, and one who appears to have means. <g id="female_youknows" />The signs are auspicious today, you know!
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Whatever you came to our fair city looking for, <g id="male_willcoverit" />I'm happy to help. You've only to ask.
"The fisherman, Yonas?"
<g id="male_shocked" />You're looking for Yonas… really? That is a rather outlandish notion! <g id="female_thinking" />Are you a long-lost relative? Caretaker? He's quite far gone, I'm sorry to say.
<g id="female_nodding" />Comes through town now and then, often raving about Corrupted. <g id="female_explains" />I've asked him to bring his concerns to me, to avoid worrying anyone, of course.
"The Corrupted don't concern you?"

<g id="male_wavehandPshaw" />In Oxboro? Don't be absurd. This city was founded by the Roman Legion centuries ago, <g id="male_willcoverit" />including yours truly and my valiant husband, Centurion Maecia.

<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />In all this time, the city has never fallen. Yonas means well, but his fears are unfounded. <g id="male_shakehead" />That said, I don't know where he is. Ask Atticus at the inn. He'll know.
If you're here to request a ballad dedicated to your family's glory, you'll have to get in line. Half of Oxboro is acting on that craze just now.
Or perhaps you're looking for something a little more nuanced? Do tell.
"An old man named Yonas."
Oh, you're a friend of Yonas! How marvelously charming! I always worry after him. Quite lonely, the old man. But he likes it that way.
"Do you know where he is?"
I've offered to let him stay in my proprietor's guest suite, but he prefers his little hut on the pond north of the city. You'll find him there. Good luck!
<g id="male_concernS" /> Try not to look so lost, lamb. It attracts pickpockets. <g id="male_waghand02" />No, don't go clutching your valuables either. That's even worse.
"The guard said Oxboro is safe."
<g id="male_chuckle" priority="high" />Did he? I'll have to give him a talking to. <g id="female_youknow" />Gossip is more valuable than gold in this town.
I would ask you to walk softly, but the fish are already wise to me. Travel on, stranger.
Ask about Yonas in the town of Oxboro
Ask the Oxboro Guardsman about Yonas
Ask the Oxboro Constable about Yonas
Ask Atticus Delphi about Yonas
Look for Yonas's Fishing Hut east of Oxboro
Talk to Saira Yangandul
Talk to Franc Dubois
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Did you find your rambling old man? Surely someone in this town knows where to find him.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Either way, don't be a stranger. I'm working on a little deal that could earn us some real coin.
<g id="male_secretiveshort" />Keep your nose out of trouble, traveler. I<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" /> do not need another problem on my plate.
<g id="male_agree1" />Making yourself at home, I trust? <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />You must get so tired, running about all over.
<g id="male_pointLeft" />The inn has only the highest quality beds. <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />You will find your rest more than adequate. I will personally guarantee it!
These fish and I, we have a history. My lure doesn't attract their attention much, but I enjoy spending time with them all the same.
If I really want to catch fish, there are other spots not far.
The Last Soulwarden
Seek answers about the Soulwardens' fate within the tower Arcturus.
Continue your journey, traveler. The fish have grown clever here.
Ah, but you are familiar. Two voices, one mind. Yes, we've spoken before. What brings you to my hovel?
"You abandoned me."
Oh? Did I abandon you, or did I just walk ahead? I walk a great deal you know, and sometimes, my memories stay behind.
I recall... a path you started to follow, but it was one I've already trodden.
"So you were a Soulwarden?"
Me, a Soulwarden? No… that could not be. It is such a pretentious sounding name.
And the Soulwardens are all gone, Lost, Corrupted… who knows? There is a tower, not far. Go get your answers there, for I have none left.
History is filled with stories of failure… but ours will end in triumph. I promise you. Join me and we will achieve victory.
Arcturus. Yes, that's what it's called. Is it a safe place? I believe it was once.
<g id="sit_shrugbrief" />You have been to the tower then, have you? <g id="sit_headshakeno" />The ghosts of my fellow Wardens call from there, demanding that I remember.
"What do you remember?"
<g id="sit_headshakeno" />Pain. Sadness. Regret. <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />I have stemmed the waters of memory for many years, but the dam is breaking. <g id="sit_nod" />I will tell you what happened.
<g id="sit_shrugbrief" />There now, my story is complete, and <g id="sit_nod" />you know the truth of who and what I was. And of my failure.

Siege of Arcturus, Day One: We have fallen back to the tower. On all sides, the Corrupted come for us. Our lines of defense are broken, our compatriots fleeing. Those who could cover the distance have come to this ancient place seeking shelter.\nWe are preparing fortifications. We will make our stand here. I do not think it will be enough.

Siege of Arcturus, Day Six: They have broken through. We no longer have means of escape, but we were able to seal the upper floors of the tower. Even now I can hear them battering against our barrier. We have rationed our food and supplies, our weapons. They will not last much longer. \nSleepless nights are evident in frayed nerves and quiet tears. The Soulwardens search my face for composure. I cannot save them, but I will not show them my despair.

Siege of Arcturus, Day Thirteen: … supplies are exhausted. The tower shudders under their assault. There is nowhere else to go. Soon they will ascend the stair and all will be lost.\n\nThey beg me to run, to preserve the Order's future. I will not be the Last Soulwarden. I will not abandon my post.
Search Arcturus for clues about the Soulwardens' fate
Find the Soulwarden Clue in the base of the Tower
Climb to the next level of the Tower
Find the Soulwarden Clue in heart of the Tower
Pass through the Azoth-Enchanted Door
Defeat the spirits of fallen Soulwardens
Find the final Soulwarden Clue at top of the Tower
Speaker of the Angry Earth

Yonas Alazar says that if you want to become a Soulwarden, you'll need a living seed from the Angry Earth. Yonas recalls a woman in the wildnerness, elusive as a shadow, that may be able to help you acquire such a thing, if you can find her.
<g id="sit_gestureleftM" />I truly am the last. All that the Order was, <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />all that it will be, <g id="sit_headshakeno" />in this decaying mind of mine.
<g id="sit_headshakeno" />I am sorry. You have come to me seeking a way to fight the darkness within, <g id="sit_dismissLeft" />but I have nothing to offer.
"What if I became a Soulwarden?"

<g id="sit_headshakeno" />That is a… terrible idea. <g id="sit_headshakeno" />The process required to harden one's soul against Corruption demands <g id="sit_gestureleftM" />a sacrifice you cannot imagine.
<g id="sit_shrugbrief" />The days of the Soulwardens are done with, and <g id="sit_nod" />I have a great deal of fishing to do…
"Please. I need your help."
<g id="sit_dismissLeft" />Bah! Even if you were to pursue such a foolish notion, <g id="sit_nod" />you would need to forge a weapon capable of combating Corruption.
<g id="sit_shrugbrief" />And that would be difficult indeed... <g id="sit_nod" />the Angry Earth is no longer generous with its seeds of power.
"There must be a way."
<g id="sit_gestureleftM" />There was once a Huntress in these parts, <g id="sit_headshakeno" />an unfriendly and elusive sort.<g id="sit_shrugbrief" /> She spoke on the Angry Earth's behalf.
<g id="sit_nod" />You might ask about her in Oxboro, but getting her to give you a Living Seed... <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />well, don't say <g id="sit_headshakeno" />I didn't warn you.
<g id="female_youknow" />If you've come by any quality furs, do know that <g id="female_nodyes" /> I pay handsomely for the right pelts. <g id="male_think" />Or did you come seeking fashion advice?
"I'm looking for a Huntress."
<g id="male_chuckle" />The women here are not exactly the rugged sort, <g id="male_secretiveshort" />if you take my meaning.
<g id="male_explain" />Though the ever-so-charming Tekla-- er, Artificer Petrowski-- may know. <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />She IS the sort to traipse around in the woods.
<g id="female_recoilDisgustSmall" priority="high" />You smell of perfume. Have you been to see Huntsman Lee? <g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />What does he want now?
"He said you know of the Huntress."
<g id="female_thinking" />He did, did he? I've heard rumors about a strange woman who lives alone in the woods, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />but it smacks of gossip and folklore to me.
<g id="male_secretiveshort" />Mayhaps there's someone who deals in gossip that could tell you more.

<g id="female_nodyes" />My hunch about this town was right. <g id="g_male_secretive" />Did you know the jewelers deal in gold plating? <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />These pampered city-folk truly can't tell the difference.
<g id="male_compliment" />But what have you been up to?
"Looking for a 'Huntress'."

<g id="female_thinking" />Well now, that's a bit strange. I was just hearing tavern talk the other day about some wild woman in the wood. <g id="female_explains" />Like a ghost, disappears when you look at her.
<g id="female_nodding" />I'd ask the captain of the scouts - I'll wager he knows something.
<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />I know a nose sniffing for information when I see one. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />I have certainly lived here long enough.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Well, get on with it then. <g id="female_liftHandsXs" />What do you want to know about?
"A wild woman, in the forest?"

<g id="male_chuckle" priority="high" />Hah. There's legends and then there's truth - <g id="male_wavehandPshaw" />people talk nonsense, say the Huntress is <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />part animal or some kind of spirit.
<g id="male_explain" />She's actually just a recluse, makes a shrine near the mines <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />to the north of her home. I'd look there.
<g id="sit_shrugbrief" />Even if you do manage to track this Huntress down, have no expectations. <g id="sit_headshakeno" />She's not fond of other people, as I recall.
Rest now, peaceful one… and return.
You trespass on sacred ground, human. The Angry Earth do not want you here.
I hope you have good cause.
Rest now, peaceful one… and return.
You trespass on sacred ground, human.
The Angry Earth do not want you here.
I hope you have good cause.
<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />You tread on what was once hallowed ground, human. Whatever your purpose coming here, it is misguided. <g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />Go back to your settlement.
"I came to speak to you, actually."
<g id="male_chuckle" />No surprise. Your kind are always speaking, never listening.<g id="female_nodyes" /> That is why so few of you can hear the whispers of the Angry Earth.
Return to Oxboro and ask around town about the Huntress
Ask Huntsman Lee about the Huntress
Talk to Artificer Petrowski
Return to Oxboro and ask around town about the Huntress
Ask Grace O'Malley about the Huntress
Ask Captain Dubois about the Huntress
Seek out the Huntress in northern Everfall
<g id="male_willcoverit" />While you flitter off in search of a myth, I'll be enjoying the company of my betters.
<g id="female_nodding" />Their doting affection will be right profitable, I'm betting.
<g id="female_liftHandsXs" />I have it on good authority that you are becoming a regular around here.
<g id="male_explain" />Not causing any trouble, I hope? <g id="male_wavehandPshaw" />No, of course not. Not an upstanding citizen such as yourself.
<g id="female_nodding" />Good luck in your search. Though I do warn you - <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />there have been Corrupted seen in the north.
<g id="female_leanpointconvince" />If you see any of those red-eyed monsters, I'd suggest steering clear.
I remember that she was beautiful, and terrifying, and ancient, even when I was young…
<g id="female_nodshrugokay" />Still running about town I see? I hope you found old Yonas before, <g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />because the signs now are less auspicious.
<g id="female_thinking" />In fact, my husband has not returned from his travels. <g id="male_converseleft" />If you do see Centurion Maecia, tell him the constable wants to see him. Thank you.
<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />You should not be in these parts, human. This land is wounded, and it will not hesitate to deal with trespassers.
The Daughterwell
Explore the Canary Mine and purge any Corrupted manifestations might be blocking the flow of Azoth to Adiana's fountain in the Daughterwell.
<g id="female_notsure" /> You say you've come to see me, but I see only darkness dwelling behind your eyes.
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />The actions of your kind have already tainted this place, so what purpose have you now?
"I came to ask a favor."
<g id="male_shakehead" />You are wasting your time and mine.

<g id="male_pointBlame" />It is the evil of your kind that slowly spreads across the land, poisoning… everything. <g id="female_pointRight" />This fountain, once a source of life and power, now fouled.
"Can it not be restored?"
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />The flow of Azoth that once fed the fountain has become blocked, <g id="male_shrugBrief" />undoubtedly by the crimson plague that's overcome the nearby mine.

<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" priority="high" />Very well. If you can destroy whatever vile cankers have grown in the mine, we will hear your request. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Otherwise, begone.
<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />Contamination still clogs the fountain. We have nothing to say to you.
The Earth’s secret ways, once again, overcoming all
But your support will not be forgotten.
The Earth’s secret ways, once again, overcoming all
But your support will not be forgotten.
<g id="male_handheart" />We are grateful for your role in restoring the fountain, but <g id="female_youknow" />you should know that the Angry Earth is capable of defending itself against Corruption.
"How does it do that?"
<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />Our secrets belong to us alone, but we have been known to offer some boons to those <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />who prove to be our loyal allies.
Investigate {POITags} for\nthe cause of the blocked Azoth flow
Destroy sources of Corruption blocking the flow of Azoth
Cut down Corrupted Tendrils
Destroy Clotting Carapaces
Burst Incubating Corruption nodules
Return to see if your actions unblocked the Fountain
Weakness of the Ego
Use Adiana's recipe to gather the ingredients to craft a tincture that will dampen the effects of Corruption.
<g id="male_nodunderstand" />You have done your part, so I will hear what you came here to say.
<g id="male_pointBlame" />But I warn you - I have no sympathy for the plight of humans in the battle against Corruption. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />It is not our fight.
"I need a seed of the Angry Earth."
<g id="female_laughCocky" priority="high" />Hah. Do you even realize how much you ask? <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />How much your kind has already taken?
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />The Angry Earth will want to know the truth: do you plan to use this<g id="male_secretiveshort" /> seed to fight Corruption?
"Yes, I do."
<g id="female_thinking" />You are honest, aren't you? Good. We loathe deceit.
<g id="female_nodyes" />Perhaps on that account I will make your request.<g id="male_spreadarms001" /> But tell me, do you know why humans fall to Corruption, but the Angry Earth does not?
"Not entirely, no."
Because Corruption's <g id="male_pointBlame" />power feeds the ego, your kind's great weakness.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Angry Earth has no ego, and that is how it offers protection. <g id="male_itemGiveRight" priority="high" />Try this tincture recipe - I believe it will help you.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Have you made the tincture I taught you yet? You're going to need it.
<g id="female_nodding" />There now, that will afford you some protection, whether or not your request for the Seed is granted.
<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />I communed with the elements while you were away, but <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />they have not yet given an answer.
Acquire Azoth-Infused Mist
Acquire a Verdant Petalcap
Acquire an Engorged Rivercress Stem
Use Adiana's Mortar and Pestle to craft a Corruption Tincture
<g id="male_hivemind" />Adiana tells us you have come here to seek our boon.
<g id="male_shakehead" />We are not easily given to trust, especially with your kind digging, burning, destroying wherever you go.
Plans of the Pestilent
Adiana Theron suspects the Corrupted of Ebonrock Armory are looking for something. Thin their forces and determine their purpose there.
<g id="male_secretiveshort" />Your sincerity has impressed me. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />That is the only reason we are still speaking.
<g id="male_explain" />But I think it will take more than sincerity to earn the trust of the Angry Earth.
"What do I need to do?"
<g id="male_gestureright" priority="high" />The Ebonrock Caverns nearby are overrun with the Corrupted.
<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />While they may pose no direct threat to the Angry Earth, they are a scourge on the land.
"I'll drive them away."

<g id="male_chuckle" priority="high" />You alone could not <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />hope to achieve that. No. <g id="male_compliment" />Destroy as many as you can, and see if you can discover the source of this most recent incursion.
<g id="female_nodyes" />I suspect they are looking for something.
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />Red eyes in the dark, watching night and day from the Ebonrock Caverns. Purge those you can and find out what it is they seek.
Read Note 'Ebony Rocks'
Read Note 'Incursion Notes'
Defeat {targetName}
This island thrums with such sources of power... I will find them all to fortify our cause… the cause of humanity.
You resist the call, but you have seen the truth and the vision… please, waste no more time resisting. Seize your birthright and join me!
We will not be twisted!
Banish this foulness! Destroy it!
Release us, human! Please.
We are indebted to you. We will meet again.
<g id="female_gestureleft"/>My companion has told me all that transpired in the cavern. <g id="male_willcoverit" bin="1" />Not even I knew of the shrine the Angry Earth harbored there.
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />That they have succeeded in Corrupting it is... troubling beyond measure.
"You said you had defenses."

<g id="male_nodunderstand" />I did. I'd prefer to believe this an anomaly, but precautions must be taken. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I must visit the Motherwell and commune with the primal spirits there.
"What about the living seed?"

<g id="male_spreadarmscalm" />Your request has been granted, human. You should realize that this required a sacrifice, and <g id="female_headshakesmall" /> it's not a gift that would be given freely again.
Scout Ebonrock Armory for the source of the incursion
Defeat Corrupted Forces
Search for Corrupted Plans:
Investigate the Bonfire
Investigate the Command Tent
Investigate the Feasting Hall
Investigate the Cavern
Defeat Centurion Maecia
Rescue Anthurus
Escape the Cavern
<g id="male_handheart" />We are indebted to you, beyond words. Tell me, human, how did you come to find this one in that foul place?
"Adiana sent me."

<g id="male_shakehead" />This one feared for a moment it had been forgotten. Corruption clouds even the clearest of vision.<g id="male_nodunderstand" /> We are relieved to be back at the Daughterwell.
"What is the Daughterwell?"
<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />A sanctuary to the Angry Earth, a shrine that dates back to the age of the Ancients, before we even sprouted… this is our home.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />We have granted the boon you seek. Our debt to you is discharged, and we will not hesitate to hunt you should our paths cross again.
A Living Conduit
Adiana Theron has seen fit to grant you a seed of power, a fitting conduit for the weapon of a Soulwarden. Return to Yonas Alazar with news of your success.

<g id="female_nodyes" />Return to your instructor. <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />Convey to him that our gift, and the reprieve that comes with it,<g id="female_headshakeSmall" /> is not without condition.
<g id="female_pointthreaten" />Should your kind abuse it, we will visit our wrath upon you.
"What does the seed do, exactly?"
<g id="male_chuckle" priority="high" />It grants what your kind lacks - <g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />a connection to the Earth itself.

<g id="male_compliment" bout="1.5"/>You have what you came for, so be grateful, this will <g id="male_nodunderstand" bin="1"/>strengthen your soul against the evil that seeks to claim it. <g id="male_wavehandDismissive" bin="1"/>Now, begone human.
<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />You have what you need, so begone from here. <g id="male_shakehead" />This is no longer a place for humans.
<g id="litearmor_handheart" />It is a relief to see you return. Though my heart trembles to harbor hope again, <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />it's too late to turn back.
<g id="litearmor_handshipsconsider" />You were able to get a living seed of the Angry Earth, then?
"It took a little convincing."

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I'm not surprised. <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />The Angry Earth are not our allies by any stretch of the imagination. <g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />But you seem to have quite a knack for persuasion.
Return to Yonas Alazar
<g id="litearmor_tiltheadremember" />We have but one component of our conduit. Vital though it may be, <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />we must now craft the Staff that will contain it.
<g id="litearmor_youknow" />Through it, you will draw on the power of your own soul to destroy Corruption where it stands.
The Implement of a Soulwarden
In search of the haft for your Azoth Staff, Yonas indicates the existence a hidden, secret cache within the hidden interior of Canis.
"It's powered by my soul?"
<g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />Yes. The relationship between Azoth and the soul is complex, but <g id="litearmor_agree1" />it is this dynamic that gives a Soulwarden their strength.
<g id="litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />When focused through an Azoth staff, it can perform many wonders.
"How do we craft this staff?"
<g id="litearmor_converseright" />We will start with the haft. The trees from which they were once carved <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />no longer grow on Aeternum.
<g id="litearmor_sighrelief" />The only way is to find one of the hafts we hid away as the days darkened. <g id="litearmor_realize" />The Ancient ruins of Canis contain such a cache.
"Who were the Ancients?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I fear that is a question <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />none remain to answer.

<g id="litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />The Ancients disappeared thousands of years ago. We simply used the ruins to find sanctuary from the Corrupted. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />In some cases, it worked. Let us hope Canis is one of them.
<g id="litearmor_tiltheadremember" />We knew the tide was turning against us. I realize now, <g id="litearmor_agree1" />we created the caches in the hope that a day like this might arrive.

<g id="litearmor_takeandgiveitem5s" priority="high"/>Well now, it's been an age since I laid eyes on one of these. It brings back many memories… <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />not all of them painful either.
Search for a hidden cache beneath the obelisk Canis
Find the hidden entrance
Use the teleporter to enter Canis
Leap into the unknown
Descend into depths of Canis
Acquire the haft for your Azoth Staff
Forgemaster's Legacy
Search the Ancient ruin of Vulcanus for the materials to craft the Crosspiece of your Azoth Staff.
<g id="litearmor_youknow" />For the next component of the Azoth staff, <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />you must acquire one of our consecrated crosspieces.
<g id="litearmor_worry" priority="high" />It will be tricky, however, as there are certainly none of these <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />just lying about in an old chest.
"Then where do I get one?"
You can't. We had to melt them all down to make weapons during the last war. But, perhaps there's one left that wasn't melted down. Ezra might still have one.
"Why wasn't that one melted down?"
Ezra, while a wonderful forgemaster, is too sentimental. It's possible he kept one as a reminder of his past great work.
"Where do I find Ezra?"
You'll find him to the west, in the Ancient structure that houses the forge.

<g id="litearmor_agree1" />Yes, you may need to be resourceful. To the west, you will find the ancient structure that houses the forge. <g id="litearmor_youknow" />It was used by the Soulwarden Order even before my time, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />so you may still find materials scattered throughout.
"Alright. I'll go right away."
<g id="litearmor_handheart" />Mind you, tread lightly, young one. Such places belong to the past, <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />and the past has a habit of fighting back on this island.
<g id="litearmor_handheart" />Mind you, tread lightly, young one. Such places belong to the past, <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />and the past has a habit of fighting back on this island.
Fan the flames! The forge must not grow cold!
My hammer will make swift work of you!
You will be reduced to ash!
The flame... burns... eternal...

<g id="litearmor_takeandgiveitem5s" priority="high" />I see you managed it after all. A fine crosspiece, almost as fine as Forgemaster Ezra once made. <g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Did you have any trouble?
"Yes, Ezra attacked me."

<g id="litearmor_think" bout="1.5"/>Ezra? It stands to reason he would remain at his forge, even after the light left him. <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />He never did let it go cold. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />I am sure he would be pleased with your work.
Visit the Ancient Soulwarden forge to find a Warden's Crosspiece
Unearth pieces of silver from the rubble
Access the Forge within the ruins of Vulcanus
Defeat Forgemaster Ezra to Collect Crosspiece
Use the Ancient Forge to craft your Crosspiece
Return to Yonas Alazar
An Order Reborn

With the components of an ancient Soulwarden staff in hand, proceed to the forge beneath Shattered Obelisk. There, you will reignite the flame of the Soulwarden Order by bringing a new Azoth Staff into being.
<g id="litearmor_concerns" priority="high" />I fear there is little time to prepare you for what approaches.

<g id="litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />While you were away, I met a traveler who spoke of Corrupted coming down from the north. <g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />I suspect they are driven on by the same voice that plagues your mind.
"Is she their leader?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I do not know. <g id="litearmor_worry" />The traveler said the Corrupted rally around something called "The Tempest," a being they worship like a god.
<g id="litearmor_youknow" />If it is this same being that haunts you, I fear <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />your soul may be in great peril.
"It doesn't change our course."
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />No, other than maybe to give us a greater sense of urgency.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />But this is a momentous occasion - <g id="litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />you are ready to forge your Azoth Staff, and the Soulwardens will soon be born anew.
"I'm ready when you are."
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />I cannot go. You must do this alone. <g id="litearmor_youknow" />It will require the sacrifice of part of your soul.
<g id="litearmor_itemgiveright" />Place the pieces of the staff on the Ancient Altar near the Shattered Obelisk, then brace yourself. <g id="litearmor_willcoverit" />I will be with you in spirit.
<g id="litearmor_converseright" />Find the altar near the Shattered Obelisk. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />That is where the Staff-forging ritual must take place.
Wood and metal can be broken. But an ideal endures, and even in small defeats, I step closer to my victory.
<g id="litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />Welcome back. And look at you! Still as fresh as a newborn babe.
<g id="litearmor_think" />Most aspiring Soulwardens return looking at least a little pale. <g id="litearmor_agree1" />You must have extra soul to spare.
Seek the Sacred Chamber beneath the Shattered Obelisk
Construct your Azoth Staff within the Obelisk
Return to Yonas Alazar
The Defense of Everfall
Deliver news of hope to the people of Everfall. The staff in your hands carries with it the power to destroy Corruption at its roots.
<g id="litearmor_think" />I have had time to give our predicament some thought.

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />While we now possess an Azoth Staff, it is but a beginning, <g id="litearmor_youknow" />and even armed with such an implement, <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />we two are no bulwark against Corruption.
"We need to rally others."
<g id="litearmor_agree1" />I think so. Go back to Oxboro. <g id="litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />Shout from the rooftops. Bang pots and pans if you must.
<g id="litearmor_realize" />Rally their men and women at arms to meet the armies coming their way. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />You hold their only hope for salvation.
"What will you do?"
<g id="litearmor_willcoverit" />I must make preparations. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />The hardest part of becoming a Soulwarden is still ahead, my young friend.

<g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Rally the city against the Corrupted in the north and <g id="litearmor_gestureleft" />then meet me in the Southern ruins. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />Then you can become a true Soulwarden, if you still wish it.

<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />The strength of men will but stall the Corrupted threat. <g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />The staff you hold is the only way to permanently destroy the physical manifestations of Corruption.
<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />I have seen you puttering about town before, and quite busily at that! <g id="male_secretiveshort" />Seeking rumors and ghosts and all manner of snooping.
<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />Just what have you been up to, hm? A magistrate has a right to know.
"I've come to fight the Corrupted."
<g id="male_shocked" />Is THAT what all this hustle and bustle was about? <g id="male_waghand03" />My friend, we are perfectly capable of mounting a defense. Our guards are the finest in Aeternum.
<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />Why not rest a while, perhaps leave some coin at our fine establishments?
At last! Someone in this foppish little city I can have decent conversation with!
C’mon over! Gab a minute with your friend, Grace!
I’ve been poking around town, collecting gossip from all these fine lords and ladies… I might stay a while.
There’s a lot of coin changing hands around here… Let me tell ya…
At last!
Someone in this foppish little city I can have decent conversation with!
C’mon over! Gab a minute with your friend, Grace!
I’ve been poking around town, collecting gossip from all these fine lords and ladies…
I might stay a while.
There’s a lot of coin changing hands around here…
Let me tell ya…

<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />So now you know what I've been up to, but what about you? <g id="male_complimentplayer" />I see that fancy new staff you're toting around. What do you plan to do with that?
"I need allies to fight Corruption."

<g id="male_righthandNodeal" priority="high" />I fought enough red-eyed rotters on the beach. If you get in a jam,<g id="male_nodunderstand" /> I've got your back, but I'm <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />not enlisting in that crusade.
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />These fine folks seem to think they haven't a problem in the world beyond a shortage of herbs… <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />you might try the Constable.
"Constable Maecia?"

<g id="female_nodyes" />That's the one. She's a former Roman Legionnaire, <g id="female_leanforwardListenNod" />and you didn't hear it from me, but I hear her husband's gone missing. She might listen.
<g id="female_youknow" />Hello, my busy friend! The signs are good today. <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />I feel quite certain today's the day Centurion Maecia will finally return home!
"I'm sorry. Your husband is Corrupted."

<g id="male_wavehandPshaw" />Corrupted? That's preposterous! <g id="male_nodunderstand" />He's battled the demon hordes more times across the centuries than I can count. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Besides, I would've seen the signs.

<g id="female_thinking" />I've heard the reports, of course. Corrupted in some isolated spots in north Everfall. <g id="male_waghand03" />But they're not massing for an attack, all the signs are good.
"Shouldn't we make sure?"

<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />Now you sound like my husband. Always skeptical. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />He'll return soon! For now, <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />try Captain Dubois. Perhaps he can spare some soldiers for you.

<g id="female_bowShallow" />A fine day to you, traveler. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />I trust your meeting with the Constable was mutually beneficial. <g id="male_converseleft" />Was there anything I can offer you to support your interests?
"Yes, soldiers to fight Corrupted."
<g id="male_chuckle" />Ah, well, I've heard the reports, <g id="male_complimentplayer" />and I salute your courage in battling the crimson menace. That staff appears to be a formidable weapon.
Rally Oxboro to help fight the Corrupted
Talk to Magistrate Clark
Meet Grace O'Malley in the Oxboro Tavern
Ask Constable Maecia to help fight the Corrupted
<g id="litearmor_agree1" />Seeing is believing. They may not understand what you hold in your hand, <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />but you can teach them with your deeds.
<g id="female_nodding" />Your pockets sound entirely too heavy. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I can recommend some choice venues to leave some of it for our communal coffers.
<g id="male_explain" />A settlement this grand does not pay for itself!
<g id="female_worry" priority="high" />I don't understand what's taking Centurion Maecia so long! <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />The signs have promised his return almost every day!
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />You're a real puzzle, you know? Delving into ruins and danger <g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />to rescue a town that can't be bothered to rescue itself.
<g id="female_nodyes" />Some day I'd like to know just what's <g id="female_taptemple" />knocking about in that head of yours.
The Invasion of Everfall

Though the townsfolk of Everfall refuse to help themselves, you have the means to protect them. Guard Captain Franc Dubois offers moral support for your quest to battle the Corrupted in Northern Everfall. He simply asks you to keep an eye out for Herbalist Howe during your travels.

<g id="male_apologize" />Unfortunately, I cannot send soldiers to join you on your mission. <g id="female_nodshrugokay" />Every available guardsman is deployed now in an effort to combat the current crisis.
"What crisis is that?"

<g id="male_shocked" />Why, you haven't heard? Impossible! There's a devastating shortage of herbs! <g id="female_explains" />Many of our wealthiest citizens depend on such herbs for happiness and health.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />The herbalist who normally caters to our city is named Howe, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />but he hasn't made an appearance in months. We've sent search parties.
"Is that really a crisis?"

<g id="female_nodyes" />For Oxboro, it is a crisis of the highest order. So by all means, <g id="male_willcoverit" />your campaign gets my full moral support, but <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />do look out for Howe. <g id="g_male_headnodyes" />Good luck!
<g id="female_leanpointconvince" />I hope you have great success in battling the Corrupted. And more importantly, finding our friendly Herbalist, wherever he may be.
The destiny of this island is already decided. Do you not see it? The weak shall succumb and the strong shall prevail.
The destiny of this island is already decided. Do you not see it?
The weak shall succumb and the strong shall prevail.
You raise your fist against the crimson storm, but it is a force of nature and destiny. Join the Tempest, and be the storm.
You raise your fist against the crimson storm, but it is a force of nature and destiny.
Join the Tempest, and be the storm.
<g id="male_darnit" priority=""high" />Will you look at my cart?! As if I haven't had enough trouble already this year! <g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />It's not fair! It's not fair, I tell you!
<g id="male_pleadhandsopen" />Do you see this? Or are you going to just walk on by like everyone else? <g id="female_nodyes" />These roads are supposed to be safe!

<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" bout="1.5"/> What dark times these must be for people to just turn away from a poor, <g id="male_willcoverit" bin="1"/>innocent merchant who's been waylaid by rabid wolves…
"You need your things back?"

<g id="female_waveoffDisdain" bout="1.5"/>Naw, the wolves were vicious and slobbery, but they didn't get any of the good stuff. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I just need someone to help right my cart!

<g id="female_whattheheck" priority="high" />Do I look like a lumberjack or some muscle-bound warrior who can lift a heavy weight with their pinky finger? <g id="male_willcoverit" bin="1"/>I need help here.
"I can right your cart! Standby!"

<g id="female_sighrelief" />Finally, someone with a heart! <g id="male_secretiveshort" />Help me out here and I'll see you richly rewarded in Oxboro. <g id="female_nodyes" />I've got friends there in high places, I do.

<g id="male_handheart" />You have a heart of gold, good traveler. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I would stay and chat, but <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />I am urgently needed elsewhere, and Howe always provides!
<g id="male_quidproquo" />Oh, rotted turnips! I meant to save some herbs for you, but these fine people had the greater need... <g id="female_nodyes" /> and the coin. Now, time to get my new cart!
Is it…? Yes, it is! We are saved!
I can't believe it - Oxboro survives its greatest threat yet…
Herbs and Spices for everyone! Hero Howe to the Rescue!
I told ya these people are somethin' else... got their heads in the clouds.
I've never met an herbalist as popular as yer Mr. Howe... but maybe they weren't pickin' the right herbs.
[Cheering]
I told ya these people are somethin' else...
Got their heads in the clouds.
I've never met an herbalist as popular as yer Mr. Howe...
but maybe they weren't pickin' the right herbs.
<g id="female_leanpointconvince" />You and I know the truth, don't we? Herbalist Howe may get all the glory, <g id="male_compliment" />but you're the one who did the work. You're the real hero.
"I don't seek applause."

<g id="female_waveoffDisdain" />Nah, you'd be a fool if you did! Flying your flag everywhere is just an invitation for trouble. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />You and the old codger are more my sort of people.
<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" priority="high" />The staff has done its work- I can taste it in the air. <g id="female_nodyes" /> Consecrated ground will repel the Corrupted for a time.
<g id="female_thinking" />I'd say you were born to be a Soulwarden, if that weren't such a tragic notion.
"You can taste Corruption?"
<g id="female_nodding" />Oh yes, a side effect of the process. Like it or not, you'll be able to taste Corruption soon, too.
<g id="male_secretiveshort" />Like a rotten tooth, sweet with decay, followed by an aftertaste of blood. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />It quite ruins dessert, I'm afraid.
Repel the Corrupted in north Everfall\n(Look for Hapless Howe too)
Talk to Hapless Howe
Fix Hapless Howe's Cart
Repel the Corrupted in north Everfall
Defeat Corrupted Invaders
Use your Azoth Staff to destroy Corrupted Growths
Find the Corrupted Invaders' source of power
Defeat {targetName}
Use your Azoth Staff to clear Colossal Corruption
Return to Oxboro with news of your victory
Talk to Avita Maecia
Talk to Grace O'Malley
<g id="female_applause" />Howe made it back! And with all his goods intact. <g id="female_nodyes" />This is marvelous! One less thing to worry about!
"What about the Corruption?"

<g id="female_waveoffDisdain" />I feel confident this will sort itself out. Howe's return is such an auspicious occasion. <g id="female_sighrelief" />I must believe that Centurion Maecia will return very soon now.
<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" />You return! I think you will be delighted to learn that our little problem with the Corrupted appears to have taken care of itself.
<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" /> All's well that ends well.
<g id="male_shakehead" /> I would not have believed it, if it had not happened so soon after your departure.
<g id="male_secretiveshort" />We have new cause for hope in you, my friend, and I am now spreading the word.

<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />These ruins are among the most elaborate in all Aeternum. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />There is much here that is sacred, and much that is very dangerous, too.
Destiny Unearthed
Acquire a Heartgem, meant to shield your soul against the effects of Corruption. Search southern Everfall for rare reagents needed to create a new Heartgem.
Forge Your Own Destiny
Search southern Everfall for rare reagents needed to create a new Heartgem.

<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Your success with the staff you forged proves your readiness. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />It is now time for you to face this final step <g id="male_nodunderstand" />to becoming a true Soulwarden.
"What must I do?"

<g id="male_compliment" />You must acquire a Heartgem - your defense against Corruption - a vessel you'll use to <g id="male_handheart" />encase your soul and protect it, a cold vault within your chest.
"Within my chest?"

<g id="male_nodunderstand" />Yes, <g id="female_waveoffDisdain" />but do not get hung up on details, there will be a time to discuss such things. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />For now, you must simply acquire the gem.

<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />Look here, these Ancient Guardians were once human, proud warriors. In a war now lost to time, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />they sacrificed in ways much like the Soulwardens.
"So they have Heartgems?"

<g id="female_headshakeSmall" /> No, but the elements for creating a Heartgem, they do. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />This will be no easy task, but <g id="male_compliment" />I believe in you. I will wait here.
<g id="male_spreadarmscalm" />Just as the Azoth Staff is the extension of the Soulwarden's strength, <g id="male_willcoverit" />the Heartgem is the source of the Soulwarden's defenses.

<g id="female_takeAndGiveItem8s" priority="high"/>Look at that - an empty Heartgem. Almost brings a tear to my eye. Take a good look, because this thing is going to <g id="male_nodunderstand" />become part of you forever.
To acquire a Heartgem:
Talk to Yonas for Options [Solo]
Complete Quest: Forge Your Own Destiny [Solo]
OR:
Delve into Amrine Excavation [Group]
Enter the Amrine Excavation
Search the Amrine Excavation for a Heartgem
Search for the Heart of a Guardian in the ruins
Defeat Ancient Guardians to collect the Heart of a Guardian
Search for Icebound Gemstone in the Caves
Use your Azoth Staff to collect the Icebound Gemstone
Collect Azoth Dust from Guardians at the Shattered Obelisk
Defeat Ancient Guardians to collect Azoth Dust
Construct your Heartgem in the Azoth Font
The Ritual
Complete the ritual deep in Amrine Temple to conquer death and become a Soulwarden in full.
<g id="male_spreadarmscalm" />A Soulwarden's power comes from creating distance in your soul, <g id="female_explains" />like a firebreak in the forest.
<g id="male_handheart" />The Heartgem provides that barrier, inuring your soul against Corruption.
"So I'll be immune to Corruption?"
<g id="male_shakehead" />Not entirely. You can still fall to temptation or rage, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />but it offers protection, a buffer.
<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />Sadly, it also buffers against the taste of food, the warmth of sunlight... the love of another. <g id="male_crossarmsdoubt" />Are you sure you're ready?
"Yes. What do I have to do?"
<g id="male_chuckle" priority="high" />Oh, that part is simple - easier than it was, at least. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />You just have to... die.
"Sorry, did you say I have to die?"

<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />That is the easy part. First, <g id="male_compliment" />you must enter the Heartforge and face its guardian. Then we will complete the ritual. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />Trust me now, and go.

Don't worry too much about the ritual. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />You know you're going to die, so it can't be any worse, can it? <g id="male_realize" />In all honesty, it probably can, but let's pretend.
You tread on sacred ground. Begone.
Turn back now. Only death awaits you here.
We see your strength. Approach the Forge and embrace your destiny.
For this to work, you must surrender… without reservation.
Be still.
The ritual is complete.
For better or worse, you are now a true Soulwarden.
For this to work, you must surrender…
Without reservation.
Be still.
The ritual is complete.
For better or worse…
You are now a true Soulwarden.
Our bond will not be so easily severed. You have shielded your heart, but not your mind. Your mind will guide you to me.
<g id="male_bowDeepHandsfolded" priority="high" bout="1.5"/>Welcome back, Soulwarden. You are now part of a legacy <g id="female_nodyes" />that goes back beyond the reach of history.

<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You have done more than surrender a life, <g id="male_handheart" />you have surrendered your own soul.<g id="male_bowshallow" priority="high" /> I salute your sacrifice.
Seek out the ritual site within Amrine Temple
Pass through the Soulwarden Seal
Defeat the Heartforge Guardian
Complete the Ritual
Leave through the Soulwarden Seal
The Three Way War
Neutrality is a dangerous prospect in these times. Seek out and speak to representatives from each of the warring factions to inform your choice of allegiance.
Ah, the old man Yonas, right? Yes, he passes through often, always raving about Corruption.
He lives outside the walls, in a cabin to the east. Be careful if you're headed that way, or at least don't say I didn't warn you.
"I will be careful."
Hold a moment. You look like someone who's handy with a weapon.
I keep an eye out for such talents. If your allegiance hasn't already been claimed, there are those who'd like to change that.
"Allegiance to whom?"
Well, the towns are always looking for able-bodied workers - got the Town Board for that.
But if you know how to fight, well, then you could join up with one of the factions.
"What factions?"
The Covenant, Marauders, and Syndicate are the heavy hitters these days, always vying for influence.
You'll find agents of all three in town, or not far. I'd talk to them. Neutrality doesn't offer many perks, you know?
I really do suggest you seek out the factions when you have time. Find out what they're all about and join up, if you're so inclined.
Seek out the Covenant
Seek out the Syndicate
Seek out the Marauders
Once upon a time, the initiation of a new Soulwarden was cause to party for three days and nights.
But there's only two of us now. It would be a very subdued affair.
You’ve been to the tower then, have you?
The memories return to me now… painful memories.
I was one of them… a Soulwarden.
I will tell you what happened, how it all ended.
Something to report? I'm only allowed to deal with minor public disturbances.
For any mercantile disputes, you'll have to plead your case with one of the noble families.
"Actually, I'm looking for someone."
Aren't we all? But information is power here. What you know, who you know… it could get you thrown down a hole somewhere.
If you're determined, look for Saira. She knows things, whether she admits it or not.
But I'll give you this tip for free: not much gets past Guard Captain Dubois. He keeps his eye on who's coming and going.
Which is unfortunate if you are trying to get something into the city unnoticed, if you get my meaning.
If you are looking for my proprietors, I am afraid they are not taking appointments today. Unless there is something else I can assist you with?
"I'm looking for the hermit Yonas."
Can't say that name sparks any torches, perhaps he was just passing through?
If that's the case, I'd ask Guard Captain Dubois. He keeps his eye on who's coming and going.
Eh, eh, eh… if you've come to grease my palms about a permit, demand my aid in a petty squabble, or accuse me of some insane crime, then move along.
I am afraid I am VERY busy today.
"I'm looking for an old fisherman."
Ah, the old man Yonas, right? Yes, he passes through often, always raving about Corruption.
He lives outside the walls, in a cabin to the east. Be careful if you're headed that way, or at least don't say I didn't warn you.
Every time you cross that threshold, I cringe a little. There is a loose floorboard just to the left of the entry, and in my mind's eye, I see you taking a great tumble.
Oh no, that sounded like a threat! I promise it was not!
They have breached the tower! Fall back!
Romanos! No!
Retreat! That's an order, Krempel!
They are coming! Yonas, you must go now! Save yourself!
I will not abandon you!
We will follow. Go now! Before it is too late!
I will clear the way. Break ranks! Prepare to retreat!
I am so sorry, Yonas. The Order lives on through you.
Soulwardens! To arms!
We will never surrender!
Hold fast!
Yonas... forgive me...
Never give in!
My mind... is my own...
Stay strong!
Stay... behind me...
We fight to the last!
Never... surrender...
Again you return. Again that expectant look on your face. What misery do you bring to me? What answers did the tower provide?
"The Soulwardens are gone."
I see. They clamor, their ghosts. Begging me to remember.
I see failure. I see a crushing, final defeat. My friend, I believe your hope is long gone from this world.
Was your offer insincere? Or do you lack the strength to follow through?
Corruption, blocking the flow of Azoth through earthly passages?
Impossible. There must be another explanation, but I will look into the matter myself.
You've rested your faith in me, but it is unfounded, and there is nowhere else you will find the strength you seek to leverage.
I burned my hand cooking breakfast this morning… it feels like an omen.
There isn't anything I should know about, is there? Maybe Franc has heard something…
Well, the fountain is running again, so you've either been blessed with good fortune, or you actually followed through.
I'm curious, however. What caused the blockage?
What this land needs is fewer humans, time to heal… and a working Azoth fountain. This one seems to be blocked.
"Maybe we can help each other."
The flow of Azoth that feeds this fountain comes from the caves nearby, where I suspect it has become blocked.
Get it flowing again and I will at least listen to what you have to say.
The fountain still runs dry. That means you haven’t yet done as we asked.
I did. I'd prefer to believe this an anomaly, but precautions must be taken.
I must visit the Motherwell and commune with the primal spirits there.
Give Yonas my regards. If he is your teacher, then you may yet defeat the darkness in your soul. Begone now, human.
There is nothing else for you right now. You should begone from here. But… I do wish you good fortune in your future travels.
You can't. We had to melt them all down to make weapons during the last war.
But, perhaps there's one left that wasn't melted down. Ezra might still have one.
I'm sure in time he will forgive your theft.
Our need is greater than his. Hopefully he'll see that someday.
Show them the way forward.
Don't bother talking to that Magistrate fellow.
It's a waste of time talking to such fools. Their power is getting others to do things, not doing it themselves.
"Who should I speak with then?"
I've heard the constable here in Oxboro came from the old Roman Empire centuries in the past.
Some say she's gone a little soft in the head, but maybe that means she'll take you serious.
Well that’s a serious face if I've ever seen one. Is anything amiss? Do I need to summon a guard?
The Corrupted? You should know it is HORRIBLE bad luck to utter the name of the enemy aloud!
No, no, no, I'll not have you summon a dark cloud over this peaceful town! I must ask you to leave at once.
Ever since you went in search of your Huntress, I've been plying everyone with a modicum of power to do something, anything, to prepare themselves for war.
I confess, I am near to the end of my wits.
I am going to need to ask a priest to consecrate this place after you brought that language in here.
No, no, don't say anything else. Let's just forget this ever happened.
Captain Dubois seems to be the only one who can command their attention!
The fact that you are still standing here suggests there's something you haven't told me.
If it's about the Corrupted coming, I already know, but these others, they won't understand the danger until it's too late.
"This weapon can defeat Corruption."
Can such a thing exist? It feels too good to be true. Here we are teetering on the edge of disaster, and you conveniently have the answer?
Sorry, but I've patrolled the streets of Oxboro long enough to know this ruse.
"It is a relic of the Soulwardens."
The Soulwardens? I've heard stories, but not in any context which would give me hope. Ha!
But by all means, if you want to battle the Corrupted, you'll find them at the farms to the north. I won't be holding my breath.
Perhaps, with proof, I can finally convince this mess of a town to fight back.
"I couldn't do nothing."
Still, you are a fine representative for humanity. I hope this seed protects you well.
I have to hand it to you, you're turning into quite the hero.
Running off into the woods after a ghost, returning determined to battle those red-eyed demons, and now I hear that SOMEONE beat back the Corrupted in the north. Now who could that be, I wonder?
Don't say I didn't warn you now, but you get used to it, sort of.
There is just one more thing you need before you can be anointed as a Soulwarden.
I wish they had not delved into this sacred place, but it is serendipitous in a way.
It is much harder to create a Heartgem than it is to find one.
"What's that?"
A Heartgem - a vessel you'll use to encase your soul, protect it, a cold vault within your chest.
And the place you'll have to go to get one is a cold vault in the earth, beneath the Amrine Temple.
"Why down there?"
It was once a sacred vault, but long-abandoned even during my prime, now an excavation.
It's the only place I know to get an empty Heartgem. You'll need your staff to gain entry. Good luck.
You should be able to open the Amrine temple door with that staff of yours. Bring back the Heartgem, and we can finally start the ritual.
Look at that - an empty Heartgem. Almost brings a tear to my eye.
Take a good look, because this thing is going to become part of you forever.
Once again, I can't hold your hand, but my spirit is with you, and I will see you on the other side. Godspeed, {playerName}.
Don't worry too much about the ritual. You know you're going to die, so it can't be any worse, can it?
In all honesty, it probably can, but let's pretend.
Hmm. This place is familiar. My feet remember what my mind does not.
Have you found any new voices, haunted one?
What were they? My mind itches, yes, at the word. Perhaps this is where my ghost lives.
That cave. Yes. Inside it. Something that needs retrieving.
The ghosts are loud here... this place remembers sorrow. My bones rattle with it.
You went into the cave. What did you find?
